title: How to Create Professional Quote Templates
description: Stop sending prices via text. Professional quotes justify premium pricing and win more jobs.
requirements: Google account (for Google Docs) or Canva account

steps.title: Choose your tool
steps.description: Pick a free tool to create your quote template.
substeps: Google Docs: Simple, free, works on any device — best for most people
Canva: Prettier templates if you want more design — canva.com
Wave: If you already use Wave for invoicing, it has quotes too
steps.tip: Google Docs is the fastest. Don't overthink it — a clean, clear quote beats a fancy one.

steps.title: Create your quote header
steps.description: Set up the top section that stays the same on every quote.
substeps: Add your business name in large, bold text
Add your logo (if you have one)
Include: phone, email, website, license number
Add 'ESTIMATE' or 'QUOTE' as a clear label

steps.title: Build the quote body
steps.description: Create the main section where job details go.
substeps: Subtotal, tax (if applicable), TOTAL in bold
steps.tip: Use a simple table for line items. Keep descriptions clear — 'Install new water heater' not 'WH inst.'

steps.title: Add terms and next steps
steps.description: Include important details at the bottom.
substeps: Payment terms: 50% deposit, balance on completion
How to accept: 'Reply YES to this email' or 'Sign below'

steps.title: Save as a template
steps.description: Make it easy to reuse for every quote.
substeps: In Google Docs: File → Make a copy (each time you need a new quote)
Create a folder called 'Quotes' to stay organized
For each new quote, copy the template and fill in the details

successMessage: You now have a professional quote template! Customers take you seriously when you look professional.
proTips: Send quotes as PDFs — they look more professional and can't be accidentally edited
Include photos of similar work you've done if possible
Always follow up 2-3 days after sending if you don't hear back
